Option B lists all of these options, making it the correct answer. Option A includes a beta-blocker, which is no longer recommended as a first-line treatment option. Option C includes a loop diuretic, which is recommended for patients with heart failure or chronic kidney disease, but not necessarily as a first-line treatment option for hypertension. Option D includes an alpha-blocker, which may be used for patients with benign prostatic hyperplasia or Raynaud's syndrome, but is not recommended as a first-line treatment option for hypertension.
